title: FOIA Request – Police Funding & Surveillance Spending

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Budget & Spending on Law Enforcement
 - The full annual budget breakdown for the Flint Police Department over the last five years.
 - All federal, state, and private grants received by law enforcement agencies for policing and surveillance technology.
 - A full report on how civil asset forfeiture funds have been allocated and spent.
 - Any public records on contracts with private security, surveillance, or intelligence firms (Palantir, Flock Safety, Clearview AI, Axon, etc.).
 - Breakdown of spending on riot control and protest management tools, including:
	-Tear gas
	-LRADs (Long Range Acoustic Devices)
	-Rubber bullets & kinetic impact projectiles
	-Surveillance drones

Surveillance Technology & Intelligence Spending
 - All procurement records for facial recognition systems, predictive policing AI, and data analytics tools.
 - All contracts with third-party data brokers used by law enforcement.
 - Any records related to payments made to Flock Safety for license plate readers or other surveillance tools.
 - Documentation on public-private partnerships regarding law enforcement technology & AI-driven policing.

I request digital copies of these documents. If any part of this request is denied, please provide the specific legal exemption being cited.

I request a fee waiver as this information is in the public interest. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michigan Transparency

title: FOIA Request – Surveillance & Riot Control Equipment

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request – Surveillance & Riot Control Equipment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Statewide Surveillance & Intelligence Sharing
 - All deployment logs and internal policies related to the use of Stingray (cell-site simulator) technology in the last five years.
 - All statewide License Plate Reader (LPR) data retention policies and agency access logs.
 - Copies of any agreements with the FBI, DHS, or other federal agencies regarding data sharing of facial recognition and predictive policing technology.
 - Any contracts, policies, or usage records for predictive policing algorithms used by the Michigan State Police.
 - Any records on the use of AI and machine learning tools for social media and online tracking.

Riot Control & Military Equipment
 - Full inventory of crowd control weapons owned by the Michigan State Police (including tear gas, LRADs, rubber bullets, and drones).
 - Deployment records for military-grade vehicles (MRAPs, BearCats, etc.) for civilian policing.
 - Internal training manuals and policies regarding handling protests, civil unrest, and mass demonstrations.
 - Any documentation on the use of undercover agents or confidential informants in activist groups.

Budget & Procurement
 - All contracts and purchase orders for surveillance technology providers (e.g., Palantir, Clearview AI, ShotSpotter, Flock Safety).
 - A full breakdown of grants and federal funding received for law enforcement surveillance in the last five years.
 - A copy of any budget reports detailing money allocated to counter-terrorism or domestic security operations.


I request digital copies of these documents. If any part of this request is denied, please provide the specific legal exemption being cited.

I request a fee waiver as this information is in the public interest.

Please confirm receipt of this request and respond within 5 business days, as required by Michigan FOIA law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michigan Transparency
